list.name: Thiago Valverde
list.testimony:
Name: Thiago Valverde de Souza
Previous role: Backend Developer
Salary before mentorship: USD 13k
Current role: Web3 Developer / Backend Developer
Current salary: $22k
Experience: 24 years old
Mentorship length: 1 month
Strategies: Job through applications. Created some repos but didn’t share on code up yet.
4 hours/day applying with customized CV and cover letter.
Web3 study, aligning speech to get a job abroad - Self learner talking about other career shifts.
In 1 month there were 19 processes where I passed the initial screening, 3 offers declined because they were not the desired rate or were web2.

list.name: Arthur Duarte
list.testimony:
Forget the stock market - invest your money in access to people and knowledge instead.
Last year I paid to join a coding community with fellow Brazilian developers, and it completely changed my life.
Being around different people who all had the same goals and were looking for the same things made me realize how important community and the right guidance really are.
I genuinely feel like paying for access to people is the best investment you can make.
Put your money towards knowledge and access to people and places.

PrivacyPolicy.s1Body: We are Borderless Coding. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, share, and protect your information when you use our websites, programs, mentorships, and platform (collectively, the Services).

s2Items.account: Account & Contact: name, email, password hash, phone (optional), location (city/country).
s2Items.billing: Billing: payer name, address, tax IDs (if provided), partial payment details handled by processors (Stripe/Appmax)—we do not store full card numbers.
s2Items.usage: Usage & Device: pages viewed, clicks, IP, approximate location, device, browser—via cookies or similar tech.
s2Items.content: Content & Submissions: messages sent via forms, forum posts, assignments, uploaded files.
s2Items.mentorship: Mentorship/Programs: scheduling info, progress, feedback, recordings/notes (if consented).

PrivacyPolicy.s3Title: 3. How we use data (purposes & legal bases)

s3Items.provide: Provide the Services (contract) – account creation, authentication, course/mentorship access, payments, receipts.
s3Items.improve: Operate & Improve (legitimate interests) – analytics, debugging, preventing abuse, training quality.
s3Items.comms: Communications (consent/legitimate interests) – onboarding emails, product updates; marketing emails only with opt‑in and easy opt‑out.
s3Items.compliance: Compliance (legal obligation) – tax/audit records, fraud prevention, court orders.

PrivacyPolicy.s4Body: We share data with service providers/processors strictly to run the Services: Stripe, Appmax, Resend (email), Vimeo (video), Notion (internal docs), Analytics/Ads (Google/Meta), and other vetted vendors listed here: /legal/vendors. We may share as required by law, during a merger/acquisition, or to prevent fraud/abuse.
PrivacyPolicy.s5Body: We use essential cookies (login, session) and optional analytics/ads cookies. You can manage preferences via our cookie banner (Granular: Essential / Analytics / Marketing). See /legal/cookies for details.
PrivacyPolicy.s6Body: We operate internationally. Where laws (e.g., GDPR/LGPD) require, we use approved safeguards (e.g., SCCs, contractual clauses) for cross‑border transfers.

s7Items.account: Account data: for the life of the account + up to 7 years for finance/audit.
s7Items.program: Program records: 24 months after completion unless you request deletion earlier (subject to legal obligations).

PrivacyPolicy.s8Body1: Depending on where you live (e.g., EEA/UK – GDPR, Brazil – LGPD, California – CPRA), you may have rights to access, correct, delete, port data, object/restrict processing, and withdraw consent.
PrivacyPolicy.s8Body2: To exercise rights: email contato@borderlesscoding.com. We will verify your identity and respond within the legally required time.
PrivacyPolicy.s9Body: Our Services are for individuals 16+ (or local age of digital consent). We don’t knowingly collect data from children.
PrivacyPolicy.s10Body: We use industry standard controls: encryption in transit, access controls, least‑privilege, audit logs, vendor reviews, and regular backups. No method is 100% secure.
PrivacyPolicy.s11Body: We may update this policy from time to time. Material changes will be announced via email or in‑app notice. Effective date: {date}

standardItems: Cooling‑off: Full refund within 7 days of purchase if you haven’t accessed paid content or attended live sessions.
After 7 days or after accessing content/live calls: All sales are final for cohorts and mentorships (your seat is reserved and capacity‑limited).
generalItems: Payment plans: You are committing to the full program price; installments continue unless a refund is approved under the rules above.
Chargebacks: Please contact support first; friendly chargebacks may lead to account suspension.
Digital products (templates, recordings): Non‑refundable after download/access.
Scheduling fees or third‑party costs: Non‑refundable if already incurred.
RefundPolicy.processBody: Email contato@borderlesscoding.com with your order ID and reason. We respond within 5 business days.
RefundPolicy.methodBody: Returned to the original payment method within 5–10 business days after approval (processor dependent).
RefundPolicy.abuseBody: We may deny repeated refund requests by the same customer.

HowItWorks.overviewBody: Borderless Coding provides digital services: mentorships, cohort programs, and access to an online platform. Nothing physical is shipped.
purchaseItems: You’ll receive an email receipt and account‑activation link.

You’ll see the Onboarding page with next steps.

Live calls via Meet; replays available if included in your plan.

supportItems: Email contato@borderlesscoding.com or use the in-app help widget.
Typical first response: within 1 business day (Mon–Fri, BRT).
cancellationsItems: You may reschedule 1:1 sessions up to 24 hours before the start time.
Late cancellations/no-shows may be deducted from your session quota.
